body: I agree. There's also the issue of duplicating the work that this would solve.

issue.title: Modernize the build system a bit.

repository.name: rollup-starter-project
repository.description: Sample project for packages built using rollup.

issue.body:
- Use mocha.opts to make it easier to run tests from IDEs.
- Use explicit extensions in imports.
- Use `targets` option to consolidate rollup config.
- Use the `es2015` preset by default, and use `babelrc-rollup` to swap the presets as needed.

body: üëç  I like that proposal, and agree that it makes sense to limit the target options to those you'd use with `bundle.write(options)` (see [here](https://github.com/rollup/rollup/wiki/JavaScript-API#bundlewrite-options-) ‚Äì¬†includes all the `bundle.generate` options [here](https://github.com/rollup/rollup/wiki/JavaScript-API#bundlegenerate-options-))

@Rich-Harris I can look into this, but I'm not sure how to handle the tests. At the moment I'm thinking I'd add the tests in the `cli` folder and allow an `_expected` folder instead of `_expected.js`, and the targets would have `dest` entries like `_actual/cjs.js` or something. Sound reasonable, or would you do a different approach?
@eventualbuddha that sounds like a good approach to me, yep
